title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 11 August 2015 - XWiki
content: has quit 01:19  has quit 03:13  has joined #xwiki 06:14  has joined #xwiki 07:53  has joined #xwiki 08:05  has quit 08:52  has joined #xwiki 09:06  has joined #xwiki 09:08  has joined #xwiki 09:29  has joined #xwiki 09:34  has joined #xwiki 09:39  has quit 10:03  has joined #xwiki 10:17  has joined #xwiki 10:29  has joined #xwiki 10:57  can i embed js in a markdown post ? 10:57  eg something like this? 11:06  has joined #xwiki 11:10  has joined #xwiki 11:11  has left #xwiki 11:12  has quit 11:17  has joined #xwiki 11:20  has joined #xwiki 11:39  has quit 11:42  has quit 11:44  has joined #xwiki 12:03  has joined #xwiki 12:06  has quit 12:13  has quit 12:14  has joined #xwiki 12:19  has joined #xwiki 12:21  has quit 12:27 <\_cjd> has joined #xwiki 12:45  has quit 12:48  colibri skin is no longer supported in 7.x, right? so it would be ok to scrap "button" css classes in xwiki-platform where they cause trouble in flamingo? 13:13  theoretically yes …. 13:13  we preserved both classes in order to be backwards compatible 13:13  ideally I would have liked another Skin, that removes the Colibri classes. 13:14  but since we will continue to develop Flamingo, and since our structure comes not just from the skin, but in lots of places…. having something unitary is kind of hard to do. 13:14  I guess since the support is over we can remove the old classes iteratively 13:28  jusr asking beacuse of XWIKI-12397 - soemone pointed me to it 13:28  will add sceenshot, one moment 13:31  ok, screenshot done, with completely pro annotations ;) 13:42  :) 14:14  has quit 14:15  has joined #xwiki 14:27 <\_cjd> has quit 14:39  hey everyone 14:39  do you know how i can get markdown to be shown a little bit nicer? 14:40  what i mean is look at this: http://i.imgur.com/O613zSz.png 14:40  it's just the normal text looks tiny, and then it kind of is "glued" to the headers 14:40  there seems to be no way to get a space between a ## header and normal text 14:42  you can write a CSS extension in XWiki as a wiki page that adds more space if you want 14:42  well do you think it's nice? 14:42  is it dependant on the skin i'm using? 14:43  likely yes, but then the distance does not look that small in my instance 14:44  I see section editing is not enabled for me, that might make a difference 14:44  it doesn't work anyway 14:44  how can i disable it? 14:45  ah, but it should work. which version are you on ? 14:45  7.0.1 14:45  i click the button, nothing happens 14:45  and it is disabled in xwiki.cfg, have to look up the variable name 14:46  i use flamingo skin or something 14:47  skin extensions tutorial: how to add JS and CSS to you XWiki:  http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/SkinExtensionsTutorial   - always good to know in any case 14:47  yep, flamingo is the default in 7.0.1 14:48  strange, section editing works for me in 6.4.4 and 7.1.1. Did I miss a bug in 7.0.1 ? 14:49  ClemensR: well maybe it doesn't work with Markdown ? 14:49  ok i'll just upgrade now and hope i don't break the wiki 14:49  ah you use markdown as wiki syntax ? 14:49  don't want you to look into things that are old 14:49  Document Syntax = Markdown 1.1 14:50  but that should not make a difference to the generated HTML :-/ 14:50  I would have to try, markdown is disabled in my instances (because I never got around to enable it) 14:51  it's the only reason we use xWiki 14:51  we were looking for a system to document our stuff that uses markdown 14:52  ClemensR: so the html says the following 14:52  there is a  "xwiki.section.edit=1"   in xwiki.cfg to disable section edit. I guess section edit does only work with syntax xwiki/2.x - totally misses the section limits in markdown, sorry 14:52   14:52  for each edit icon 14:52  ah, ok, thats why, then better disable it for now. 14:52  yeah, it should in fact not show up ? 14:53  if i delete the span, the distance is OK 14:54  I am sure it implementaion is done that way because someone thought only the old xwiki/1.0 syntax is a problem, so it rarely happens ... but one can easily argue for the opposite 14:55  ok, then disabling section edit in the xwiki.cfg might even fix that problem 14:55  also the font size is 9px, which i also don't understand 14:56  um, yes that is not the normal layout 14:56  :S 14:59  ClemensR: it's actually 13px 14:59  my bad 15:00  I guess 14px \*should\* be the default currently ... but anyway, does it look ok now ? 15:03  has quit 15:07  ClemensR: yep, i think it will be fine. i'll let you know after the reboot 15:07  ClemensR: i saved a document now and got a Caused by: java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: Java heap space 15:07  ¨:( 15:08  JAVA\_OPTS="-mx2048m"  at least  for production instances, i you ask me 15:08  ClemensR: this is my JAVA\_OPTS="-Xms512m -Xmx4096m -XX:GCTimeRatio=2 -XX:ParallelGCThreads=8 -XX:MaxPermSize=512m -Dfile.encoding=utf-8 -Djava.awt.headless=true -XX:+UseParNewGC -XX:MaxGCPauseMillis=100 -XX:+DisableExplicitGC" 15:09  erm, ok, that should be enough 15:10  duh, any stack trace ? 15:10  yeah, but it vanished now as i reloaded the page 15:10  anything "special" about that page? 15:10  is it perhaps the "autosave" feature? 15:10  no it just contains some markdown, no macros 15:11  ah autosave is enabled for markdown ... but, nah, why should it. 15:11  you just restartet the server, right ? 15:12  no, first wanted to save the document 15:12  ok, and it bit the bucket when you pressed "save" ? 15:13  yep 15:13  and when i hit reload with "resend form data" it worked 15:14  maybe there is something in the log? I have to admit I am a bit in the dark why this should happen 15:15  i'll have a log, thanks for now :) 15:16  look\* 15:17  has joined #xwiki 15:22  ClemensR: this is from the logs 15:22  http://paste.ubuntu.com/12055457/ 15:22  no mention of hype problems, you can see the time at 13:07 is when it happened 15:24  has quit 15:24  i'm upgrading to 7.1.1 now 15:24  has left #xwiki 15:25  ok, sees there was some syntax error (either in the document, or the parser buggily "created" one, but that does not explain the OoM. 15:25  yeah, hope this helps 15:25  the OOM was shown at the bottom in the wiki 15:26  yes, usually OoM do not make to the log, not enough memory left to write them :(    (or so the vm thinks) 15:27  has joined #xwiki 15:29  there are no release notes for  XWiki 7.2 Milestone 3  yet ? 15:33  I just wonder if I should mention a fix for XWIKI-12397 , because it breaks an "API" for the skin's CSS ( no .button for buttons, but .btn ). 15:36  has joined #xwiki 15:36  has quit 15:42  ClemensR: ok upgraded, and rebooted, upgrade wizard finished 15:42  now the java is hogging 2 cpu's at 100%, not sure why 15:42  maybe i'll just let it sit a while, probably re-indexing or stuff 15:42  it is reindexing 15:43  that is "normal", it need a full solr search reindex 15:44  you might be able to track progress in the "search" section of the wiki admin 16:28  has quit 17:11  has left #xwiki 17:22  has joined #xwiki 17:25  has quit 17:28  has quit 17:52  has quit 17:53  has quit 18:03  has joined #xwiki 18:03  Hi when can we expect 7.2 18:03  ? 18:15  xwikiorg\_guest\_5: seehttp://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Roadmaps/ 18:15  http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Roadmaps/ 18:15  (bottom of page for precise dates) 18:18  thanks 18:25  has joined #xwiki 18:30  has joined #xwiki 18:42  has quit 18:49  has quit 18:54  has quit 18:55  has quit 19:34  has joined #xwiki 19:41 <\_cjd> has joined #xwiki 19:43 <\_cjd> has quit 19:47 <\_cjd> has joined #xwiki 20:11  has quit 20:14 <\_cjd> has quit 20:15 <\_cjd> has joined #xwiki 20:22  has joined #xwiki 20:25  has quit 20:31 <\_cjd> has quit 20:53  has quit 22:19  has joined #xwiki 22:22  has quit 22:22  has joined #xwiki 22:22  has quit 23:36  has quit 23:37 <\_cjd> has joined #xwiki 23:39  has joined #xwiki
